meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Russia, equal to one hundredth of a ruble.
meanings.sent1: In Russia, you can buy small items with just a few pyats.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my rubles for pyats at the market.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper refused to accept my pyats, insisting on rubles instead.
meanings.sent4: Her savings were dwindling, reduced to mere pyats in her purse.
meanings.sent5: The beggar's cup jingled with the sound of pyats from generous passersby.

meanings.definition: To strike or hit with the hand.
meanings.sent1: He pyats the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: She pyats the door in frustration when it wouldn't open.
meanings.sent3: The chef pyats the dough to shape it into a perfect circle.
meanings.sent4: The boxer's punch pyats his opponent right on the chin.
meanings.sent5: The teacher gently pyats the student's shoulder to encourage them.

meanings.definition: A type of fish commonly found in the waters of the Pacific Ocean.
meanings.sent1: The pyats swam gracefully in the clear waters of the Pacific.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen set out early to catch pyats for the market.
meanings.sent3: The aquarium's newest exhibit featured colorful pyats from the Pacific Ocean.
meanings.sent4: The chef prepared a delicious dish using fresh pyats as the main ingredient.
meanings.sent5: Children giggled as they watched the playful pyats darting around in the tank.
